intro: Psephellus dealbatus, commonly known as the white-flowered rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its leaves are basal and pinnately divided, while its flowers are white or pale yellow, often appearing in clusters. Psephellus dealbatus is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in crevices or on slopes.
